name: Bangladesh
description: Bangladesh, officially the People's Republic of Bangladesh, is a country in South Asia. It’s known as the 'Land of Bengal' and is characterized by its fertile delta region formed by the Ganges, Brahmaputra, and Meghna rivers.  It’s a densely populated country with a rich cultural heritage, facing significant challenges related to climate change and riverine flooding.  The country boasts a diverse landscape, from mangrove forests to rolling hills, and is a vital hub for biodiversity.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Bangladesh is one of the most densely populated countries in the world.
quickFacts.detail: Over half the population lives in rural areas, primarily engaged in agriculture.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: It's the world's eighth-largest country by area.
quickFacts.detail: Approximately 60% of the country is less than 10 meters above sea level.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Dhaka is the largest city and the political, economic, and cultural center.
quickFacts.detail: It's a rapidly growing megacity with significant infrastructure challenges.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: Exchange rates fluctuate, but generally, 1 USD is approximately 108 BDT.

quickFacts.label: Languages
quickFacts.description: Bengali is the official language and is spoken by the vast majority of the population.
quickFacts.detail: English is also widely used in business and education.

climateData.title: Climate of Bangladesh
climateData.description: Bangladesh experiences a tropical monsoon climate, characterized by distinct wet and dry seasons. The country is highly vulnerable to climate change impacts, including rising sea levels and increased flooding.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (March - June)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The summer months are hot and humid, with temperatures often exceeding 35°C (95°F). Rainfall is generally light during this period.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Monsoon (July - October)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The monsoon season brings heavy rainfall and flooding across the country.  The Bay of Bengal experiences strong cyclones during this time.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (November - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings pleasant weather with lower humidity and temperatures.  It's a popular time for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - April)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring is characterized by blooming flowers and pleasant weather. It's a beautiful time to visit Bangladesh.

naturalWonders.name: Sundarbans Mangrove Forest
naturalWonders.description: The Sundarbans is the world’s largest mangrove forest, shared between Bangladesh and India. It’s a UNESCO World Heritage Site and home to the iconic Bengal tiger, along with numerous other species of flora and fauna.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: This unique ecosystem is a vital carbon sink and provides crucial protection against cyclones and erosion. The intricate network of waterways and mudflats creates a mesmerizing landscape.

scientificData.Biodiversity: Over 200 fish species, 36 reptile species, 600 bird species, and 26 species of mammals

naturalWonders.name: Saint Martin's Island
naturalWonders.description: Saint Martin’s Island, also known as Haridor Mohekh, is the only coral island in Bangladesh. It’s a popular tourist destination offering pristine beaches and diverse marine life.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The island is relatively small and unspoiled, providing a tranquil escape from the bustling cities. It’s a haven for birdwatchers and offers opportunities for snorkeling and diving.

ecosystemData.title: Ecosystems of Bangladesh
ecosystemData.overview: Bangladesh’s diverse ecosystems include mangrove forests, wetlands, rivers, and grasslands, each supporting a unique array of biodiversity. These ecosystems are vital for the country’s economy, livelihoods, and climate resilience.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mangrove Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: The Sundarbans and other mangrove forests provide critical habitat for numerous species, including the Bengal tiger and various bird species.

statistics.details: Various fish, reptile, and bird species
Mangroves play a significant role in carbon sequestration

notableSpecies.name: Bengal Tiger
notableSpecies.significance: Iconic species and a key component of the Sundarbans ecosystem

notableSpecies.name: Irrawaddy Dolphin
notableSpecies.significance: Rare freshwater dolphin found in the rivers of Bangladesh

biodiversityCategories.name: Riverine Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: Bangladesh’s extensive river system supports a rich diversity of aquatic life and provides livelihoods for millions of people.

statistics.details: Rivers are a major source of fish for the country

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Bangladesh
activities.description: Bangladesh offers a wide range of outdoor activities, catering to various interests and skill levels. From exploring the Sundarbans to trekking in the hills, there’s something for everyone.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the diverse landscapes of Bangladesh on foot.

activities.name: Sangu Hills Trek
activities.description: A challenging trek through the Sangu Hills, offering stunning views of the surrounding countryside.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, backpack, water bottle

activities.name: Sonagazi Hill Trek
activities.description: A relatively easy trek to the top of Sonagazi Hill, offering panoramic views of the Meghna River.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water-based activities in Bangladesh’s rivers and coastal areas.

activities.name: River Cruises
activities.description: Relaxing cruises along the rivers of Bangladesh, offering scenic views and opportunities for wildlife spotting.
safety: Follow the instructions of the crew

activities.name: Kayaking
activities.description: Explore the waterways of Bangladesh at your own pace.

clothing.winter: Warm sweaters, jackets, trousers, scarf, gloves
